summary:
Global Sourcing and Procurement Leader with 12 years of experience in Procurement within Automotive, Luxury and FMCG industries. Strong experience in sourcing and negotiation across diverse spend categories - Packaging, Commodity, T&L, S&IM (not Marketing).

Proven track record in executing procurement function and strategies within new and complex organizations – Introduce procurement model within project phase, design and implement sourcing strategy while transitioning to an above market category management structure.

Strong business savvy - dealing with risks and opportunities, harvesting added value.

Actual professional international culture - Working experience in South Korea, South Asia, Oceania, Europe and Latin America
A self-starter with high energy and decisiveness with a unique flair to plan and organize assignments. Enjoy high pressure, taking risk and stretched timeline to deliver high results.

profile_positions.description:
Key Achievements
Developed the Global Strategies for Glass and Metals Packaging that were validated by all internal stakeholders, Procurement (Head of Spend and CPO) and Businesses (Cross Functions, Business Executives).
Achieved cost improvement goals (2 digits) including the introduction of e-auctions for leverage sub-categories.
Achieved the company sustainable commitments for CO2 reduction
Maintained 100% OTIF during the 2 years of Covid pandemic by leveraging global relationship with suppliers, negotiating new clauses to favor the company allocation in the new disrupted supply environment.
Led the Above Market Category audit for Packaging and obtained best result with no critical gap.

Roles & Responsibilities
Accountable for end-to-end Metals and Glass packaging spend management – $1B spend
Deliver annual cost improvement and PPV objectives at business and category levels.
Lead, coach, develop, evaluate and train a team of Procurement Managers
Develop advance category knowledge by ensuring people capabilities and skills are in place.
Develop robust category strategies that reduce supply base, reduce dependence on single/sole sourced suppliers, deliver continuity of supply, and provide for annual cost reductions.
Manage, strategize and deliver all aspects of Strategic Sourcing and Spend Management
Effectively partner and collaborate long term relationships with suppliers and internal stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Global Category Manager - Packaging

profile_positions.description:
Key Achievements
Developed tool and methodology for the Category team to facilitate the monthly budget exercise and improve its accuracy. Reduced by half the time spend on the forecasting exercise and ensured clear and accurate budget communication with the markets and businesses.
Brought a significant contribution to the team savings, always pushing the suppliers to deliver more, totalizing +10% savings annually from rebates, productivity clauses, forex negotiations.
Successfully managed a very complex portfolio totalizing 20 markets across Europe, Middle East, Asia and more than 60 different plants.
Excellent focus on preparing information for the businesses and driving Value Engineering projects.
Endorsed for the Procurement Leadership formation in preparation to the Global Category Manager role.
Stepped in as team manager and provided coaching and guidance during a senior manager maternity leave. Ensured targets achievement on projects and cost optimizations.
profile_positions.title: Senior Global Procurement Manager - Packaging

profile_positions.description:
Key Achievements
Transitioned the full accountable scope from at Market to above Market within 6 months, including the development of the 3-year strategies.
Achieved 15% annual cost reduction leveraging on global RFI/RFQ process.
Introduced and negotiated multi-year contracts including clauses preventing inflation pass through and enforcing year over year cost efficiency.
Proposed and led specification harmonization projects across multiple markets to consolidate the supply base, gain multiple sourcing and achieve +20% cost reduction


Roles & Responsibilities
Accountable for end-to-end Metals Packaging spend management and its transition from at Market to above Market management.
Manage the spend category and create above market spend category strategies that deliver business value, competitive advantage and which contribute to the reduction of operational risk through efficient and effective delivery.
Develop and implement the Procurement Strategy, in close collaboration with all stakeholders ensuring consistency with the company strategy & objectives 
Develop supplier relationship management and risk assessments, implementation of appropriate risk mitigation plans.
Ensure continuous connectivity with the business interacting with relevant stakeholders to provide category direction and influence pertinent strategy and decisions in the business.
Prepare and execute negotiation events seeking best TCO contracts and beneficial commercial agreements with suppliers.
profile_positions.title: Global Procurement Manager - Packaging

profile_positions.description:
Key Achievements
Trained and developed a junior buyer to support the project function.
Achieved 10% annual savings on addressable commodities spend through contract negotiations
Implemented and aligned ways of working between procurement, back office and entrance quality inspection to ensure one voice to the stakeholders.
In collaboration with the quality service, introduced AQL to suppliers to guarantee first good part delivered on time. Reduced the rejection rate by 40% on the first year. 

Roles & Responsibilities
Lead the strategic product families: sourcing, negotiations, contracting, contract management.
Promote partnership mindset with key suppliers to strengthen long term collaboration.
Develop business activity plans and achieve targets for cost reduction and supplier rationalization.
profile_positions.title: Lead Buyer (Project & Commodity)

profile_positions.description:
Key Achievements
Adapted and used automotive industry tools to suit the watch industry requirements.
Achieved to set the project buyer function in the R&D team mindset within 6 months.
Developed new supplier panel to reduce the prototyping lead time phase from 16 to 4 weeks without cost impact.
Introduced and deployed KPI to monitor the performance of the procurement function. Ensured on-time completion of each new the project development phases.
Introduced the concept of design/ value engineering review between designers and suppliers during upstream phase to ensure machinability. Improved first time delivery at required quality by 80%.
Introduced and led the validation of new machining technologies to reduced cost by 50% and lead time by 80%.

Roles & Responsibilities
Introduce the procurement function in the upstream phase of the project development.
Source and select supplier panel to meet the development needs.
Track costs through development phase and production.
Negotiate costs, minimums & lead-times.
profile_positions.title: Project Lead Buyer

profile_positions.description:
Key Achievements
Achieved 25% cost savings on industrial gas supply (national scale) by involving companies in a competitive pitch.
External Value Added/Value Engineering focus, reduced piece cost up to 15%.
All contracts negotiated prior to SOP with year-on-year cost reductions schedule (min 3%).
Successfully launched all new projects on time and met customer expectations.
Sourced OEMs cross-country projects leveraging on global sourcing and economies of scale and achieved 15% cost reduction on critical components.

Roles & Responsibilities
Issue RFQ's based on concept sheets.
Build partnership among worldwide suppliers.
Evaluate suppliers on Quality, Cost, Delivery, Development and Management.
Implement design changes with suppliers to meet joint check builds and trials.
Track costs of all components from nomination through to production costs.
Manage supply chain implementations and freight for overseas routes.
profile_positions.title: Program and Commodity Buyer

profile_positions.description:
Key Achievements
Rationalized the supplier panel and generated 20% cost reduction.
Reduced the number of routes by 30% introducing milk run for LTL deliveries. 
Eliminated empty container transportation by leveraging on inbound and outbound routes. 

Roles & Responsibilities
Map current routes and leverage on recent company acquisition to identify duplicates and identify simplification opportunities (scope of 30 plants and over 400 routes).
Monitor monthly T&L spent to find opportunities and bring out savings generated by ongoing actions.
Proactively identify risks and develop the associated risk mitigation plans for the supply base.
profile_positions.title: European Transport & Logistic Buyer
